Buffalo Bills Need to Implement “Season Position” Strategy to Win

Football,Data Analysis

October 25, 2015

All teams endure injuries, sometimes even to their best players, and find ways to win. Just ask the Green Bay Packers about this. To their credit, the Bills, when healthy and focused, should be one of the better teams in the league. Better teams in the league have high chances of winning. By transitivity, the Bills need to be healthy to win (obvious). Yet how can a team reduce it's chances of injuries? Play your marquee players less. I know this sounds crazy, but I want the Bills to sit their best players out games.

Read More

ABOUT ME

Tony DiLoreto is one part mathematician, one part data guru, and one part adventurer. I can normally be found hacking away, on top of the slopes, or above the skies. Contact Me to chat more about partnerships, board membership, volunteering, or to geek out.
